It is awesome, I wish I could play every first person shooter with a wiimote! Because it’s as close as possible to actually pointing and shooting a real gun.

item.title: Dx11 new xbox and ps capabilities
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:20, topic:403655”]Wii is 99.9% shovelware, the Gamecube was 99.9% shovelware, the n64 was at least 50% shovelware, Nintendo haven’t made a good console in years and years.

They made their decision to drop out of the console wars and cater to kids and grandmas, and they’re doing well at it. I wish them well, but they are not the Nintendo we grow up loving.

EDIT: Forgot to mention they turned into assholes, too. :P[/quote]

I don’t know if it is quite that high, but yes, there is a lot of ‘shovelware’. But you can’t judge a console just on that, look at the good games too. All of the ‘Wii Play’ type games are great, Zelda: Twilight Princess, Call of Duty 3, Mario Kart, and many others (obviously I haven’t played it recently, those were released years ago). Also the controls are just awesome, Sony even came out with a wiimote for the PS3 years later. When playing shooters or similar I feel I have better control than even with a mouse, which says a lot for a computer guy.

Read full topic

item.title: Dx11 new xbox and ps capabilities
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Wii is 99.9% shovelware, the Gamecube was 99.9% shovelware, the n64 was at least 50% shovelware, Nintendo haven’t made a good console in years and years.

They made their decision to drop out of the console wars and cater to kids and grandmas, and they’re doing well at it. I wish them well, but they are not the Nintendo we grow up loving.

EDIT: Forgot to mention they turned into assholes, too.

item.title: Dx11 new xbox and ps capabilities
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

tL:

Not what have I heard. Just what I have experience. My Wii has been off most of it’s life in my house. Much more so than my PS3 and 360 purely because of it’s lack of games.

I’ve used my Wii far more than my PS3, the games are just more fun. If I want a graphics-intensive game I go to my PC anyway. It also probably has something to do with me not being able to aim with a joystick, I can aim well with a mouse or a wii-mote though. Also, I’m almost positive the Wii has way more games than the other systems, but I’m going to assume you meant good games.

Read full topic

item.title: Dx11 new xbox and ps capabilities
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“tL, post:14, topic:403655”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=500720.msg3663174#msg3663174 date=1310460790]

Its funny watching people on youtube ratting on console graphics, they dont realize the ones they compete with now are 7 years old

5 and a half more like, 4 and a half for ps3

sony gave ps3 a 10 year lifespan

which they definitely wont be keeping
[/quote]

You both don’t understand what Sony mean when they say that. Sony mean the console will remain on the market for 10 years. Just like they did with the PlayStation 2 and PlayStation. Not once did they say they wouldn’t release a console within those 10 year life-spans and both times they have done so.

Sony can keep to the 10 year life span on the PS3 and still bring out a new PlayStation within that time.[/quote]
i did know thats what they meant but i dont see them manufacturing playstation 3s in 2017

Read full topic

which they definitely wont be keeping, the PS4 has been under development for a while, if i was going to guess at a release i’ll say 2013/2014 for the PS4 and xbox 720, because once wii-u hits they’ll want to get their products out to keep a decent market share, sony know how damaging not getting their product out first is, look at the dominance the ps2 had and then to the lackluster start of the PS3 compared to the 360, just because it had come out first

item.source: Dx11 new xbox and ps capabilities

item.title: Dx11 new xbox and ps capabilities
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:3, topic:403655”]the new xbox and ps3 I mean, coming out the fourth quarter of 2011 or early 2012.

Owell I’d rather have a $250 xbox at the time than a $1500 computer that I have to keep upgrading. Consoles usually are better (price wise) than pc for a year, then decent gaming pcs become easily available.

Its funny watching people on youtube ratting on console graphics, they dont realize the ones they compete with now are 7 years old ;)[/quote]

The most expensive computer I’ve ever built cost around $600 and it was awesome at the time, and could play anything on the highest settings, computers will always be better that consoles graphics-wise, and, let’s face it, you need one anyway, it’s not like you could just get by with only a console.

The games are also much cheaper in the end, at least than Xbox, because you don’t have to pay a monthly fee to play them.

Regardless, even if new consoles come out, I wouldn’t buy an Xbox because of that Xbox Live bullshit, and I wouldn’t buy a Playstation due to Sony screwing everyone multiple times, but especially about ‘Other OS’ support, I’d probably buy the next-gen Nintendo console, because they actually make quality stuff that is fun to play, if not the most advanced graphics-wise.

Read full topic
